Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Stephen C. Vladeck Papers
Vladeck, Stephen C.
Vladeck, Judith P.
WAG.284
1 Linear Feet in 1 record carton
1960-1978 Materials are in English Stephen C. Vladeck was the husband of Judith Vladeck and worked as a labor and civil rights lawyer and collective bargainer in higher education. This collection contains some of Vladeck's personal and professional correspondence from the 1960s to 1970s.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Stephen Vladeck was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Judith Vladeck in 1992. The accession number associated with this gift is 1992.022.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Stephen C. Vladeck Papers; WAG 284; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Historical/Biographical Note
Stephen C. Vladeck was the husband of Judith Vladeck and worked as a labor and civil rights lawyer and collective bargainer in higher education. Vladeck was also counsel to and secretary-treasurer of the Peoples Educational Camp Society, an active member of the Tamiment Institute and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives at New York University.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Processing Information
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Folders and folder titles are original.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains some of Vladeck's personal and professional correspondence from the 1960s to 1970s.
Vladeck, Judith P.
